channel.title: Comments on: Coinbase, Something Went Wrong

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/12/19/coinbase-something-went-wrong/#comment-4162">Stephane Daury</a>.
So far I haven't seen any particularly strong stabilizing elements in the Bitcoin economy. Perhaps that might come from a few existing large institutions.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Stephane Daury.

So far I haven’t seen any particularly strong stabilizing elements in the Bitcoin economy. Perhaps that might come from a few existing large institutions.

item.title: By: Stephane Daury
item.dc:creator: Stephane Daury
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/12/19/coinbase-something-went-wrong/#comment-4163">Joseph Scott</a>.
Yeah, their other charts are better. That's why I further suggested bitcoincharts.com, which gives you more choices of exchanges (MtGX is always the highest). :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

Yeah, their other charts are better. That’s why I further suggested bitcoincharts.com, which gives you more choices of exchanges (MtGX is always the highest). ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/12/19/coinbase-something-went-wrong/#comment-4161">Stephane Daury</a>.
Their "Market Price (USD)" is described as "A chart showing the USD market price from Mt.gox".
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Stephane Daury.

Their “Market Price (USD)” is described as “A chart showing the USD market price from Mt.gox”.

item.title: By: Stephane Daury
item.dc:creator: Stephane Daury
item.description:
There's also bitcoincharts.com
As far as volatility, you can say that again. But at $600, it's still 3x over what it was right before it started rising sharply. If you look at "the previous BTC bubble" (July 2013), it did about the same: from under $50 to $250 to just over $100. My bets are still on BTC being "stable" between $900-1000 by February.
But honestly, it's just playful speculation, since I didn't invest. Not much of a gambler. :)
item.content:encoded:
There’s also bitcoincharts.com

As far as volatility, you can say that again.
But at $600, it’s still 3x over what it was right before it started rising sharply.
If you look at “the previous BTC bubble” (July 2013), it did about the same: from under $50 to $250 to just over $100. My bets are still on BTC being “stable” between $900-1000 by February.

But honestly, it’s just playful speculation, since I didn’t invest.
Not much of a gambler. ðŸ™‚

item.description: I highly recommend Blockchain for such data: http://blockchain.info/charts :)
